topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Deploy the HPE Linux Patch

body.section: The HPE Linux glibc patch fixes a buffer overflow condition on systems running HPE Linux. The condition is due to multiple stack-based buffer overflows in the (1) send_dg and (2) send_vc functions in the libresolv library in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6). The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEÂ®) bulletin CVE-2015-7547 describes the condition.

Files added\impacted by this patch:
libc6
libc-bin
libc-dev-bin
libc6-dev
locales
multiarch-support

Download the patch
If you have not downloaded the patch, launch the Helion Distribution Network (HDN). You must obtain a user account on HDN in order to download these files. In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Download the patch and the associated checksum and signature files.
Verify the downloaded signature and the downloaded checksums.
Extract the compressed file until the metadata.tar.gzfile and README are available:
Extract the HCG2.0_hLinux001_Patch022.tar.gz compressed file.
Extract the HCG2.0_hLinux001_Patch022.tar compressed file.

ol.li: SSH into the lifecycle manager host as the root user.

Log into the lifecycle manager VM as root. ssh <lifecycle manager_VM_IP>
where: lifecycle manager_VM_IP is the CLM IP of the lifecycle manager. Locate the IP address for the lifecycle manager in the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file under hlm_clmstaticip field.
Copy the patch to the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>/patches directory on the lifecycle manager VM.

section.p: After copying the patch, use the following steps to deploy the patch on a Denver Deployment:

ol.li: Change to the patch directory cd /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>/patches
Execute the following command:hlm patch -c <cloud-name> -n HCG-glibc -t <tier>

SSH into the Standard Region controller using the CLM IP of the controller. Log in as the cghelion user. No password is required.ssh cghelion@<CLM_IP>
The CLM IP is located on the lifecycle manager VM in the /var/hlm/clouds/lr4tb2c1b41/desired_state/lr4tb2c1b41/001/base/stage/ansible/hosts file. Look in the [BASE-CCP-T1] section:BASE-CCP-T1-M1-NETCLM ansible_ssh_host=10.20.37.102 BASE-CCP-T1-M2-NETCLM ansible_ssh_host=10.20.37.103 BASE-CCP-T1-M3-NETCLM ansible_ssh_host=10.20.37.104
Execute the following command to patch the lifecycle manager VM: hlm patch -c <cloud-name> -n HCG-glibc -t localhost
Execute the following command to patch the Standard Region controller:hlm patch -c <cloud-name> -n HCG-glibc -t BASE-CCP-T2
Execute the following command to patch the DCN host: hlm patch -c <cloud-name> -n HCG-glibc -t BASE-CCP-T1
Execute the following command to patch the VRS-G node: hlm patch -c <cloud-name> -n HCG-glibc -t BASE-CCP-VRG
